title: Pathway Enrichment Analysis
text: Linkage can help visualize tabular graphical pathway enrichment results interested gene lists.  GOEnrichment() KEGGEnrichment() functions allow input list interested genes set four key parameters (.e., adjusted pvalue cutoff, qvalue cutoff, minimal size annotated genes testing, maximal size annotated genes testing) GO KEGG pathway enrichment analysis. Linkage offers several types visual charts interpret functional results multiple perspectives.
code: library(linkage) if (!requireNamespace("devtools", quietly = TRUE))   install.packages("devtools") if (!requireNamespace("LinkageData", quietly = TRUE)) devtools::install_github("aicplane/LinkageData") ## ── R CMD build ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## * checking for file ‘/tmp/RtmpXiRxJL/remotes3a5f4f68beea/aicplane-LinkageData-c096466/DESCRIPTION’ ... OK ## * preparing ‘LinkageData’: ## * checking DESCRIPTION meta-information ... OK ## * checking for LF line-endings in source and make files and shell scripts ## * checking for empty or unneeded directories ## Omitted ‘LazyData’ from DESCRIPTION ##   NB: this package now depends on R (>= 3.5.0) ##   WARNING: Added dependency on R >= 3.5.0 because serialized objects in ##   serialize/load version 3 cannot be read in older versions of R. ##   File(s) containing such objects: ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/ENSG00000000419.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chr1.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chr10.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chr11.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chr12.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chr13.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chr14.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chr15.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chr16.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chr17.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chr18.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chr19.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chr2.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chr20.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chr21.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chr22.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chr3.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chr4.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chr5.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chr6.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chr7.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chr8.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chr9.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Homo.ATAC/chrX.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Mus.ATAC/chr1.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Mus.ATAC/chr10.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Mus.ATAC/chr11.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Mus.ATAC/chr12.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Mus.ATAC/chr13.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Mus.ATAC/chr18.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Mus.ATAC/chr19.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Mus.ATAC/chr2.rdata’ ##     ‘LinkageData/inst/extdata/Mus.ATAC/chr3.rdata’ ## title: Gene Regulatory Network Analysis
text: wish view genetic regulatory landscape globally, Linkage can help build GRNs nodes genes corresponding cis-regulatory elements. can first calculate  enriched CREs potential regulatory peaks perform canonical correlation analysis quantitative expression level interested gene potential CREs BuildGRNs() function. Linkage offers transcription factor binding site information two species, .e., human mouse, users CREs enrichment analysis.   FilterGRNs() function allows   filter ambiguous connections gene-CREs pairs setting thresholds interactions nodes. Finally, can view corresponding informatic interactive GRNs VisualGRNs() function. example ,  visualize  GRN  “TSPAN6”, “CD99”  “KLHL13” potential CREs.
code: library(linkage) library(LinkageData) ATAC.seq <- BreastCancerATAC() RNA.seq <- BreastCancerRNA() LinkageObject <-   CreateLinkageObject(     ATAC_count = ATAC.seq,     RNA_count = RNA.seq,     Species = "Homo",     id_type = "ensembl_gene_id"   ) gene_list <- c("TSPAN6", "CD99", "KLHL13") LinkageObject <-   RegulatoryPeak(     LinkageObject = LinkageObject,     gene_list = gene_list,     genelist_idtype = "external_gene_name"   ) LinkageObject <-   BuildGRNs(LinkageObject = LinkageObject,                         Species = "Homo",                         TF_cor_method = "pearson") LinkageObject <-   FilterGRNs(     LinkageObject = LinkageObject,     genelist_idtype = "entrezgene_id",     filter_col = "FDR",     filter_value = 0.01   ) VisualGRNs(LinkageObject)

title: linkage
text: TCGA Breast Cancer cohort dataset contains chromatin accessibility gene expression data  72 patients breast cancer. chromatin accessibility data normalized bulk ATAC-seq count matrix, prior count 5 added raw counts, put “counts per million”, log2 transformed, quantile normalized.  gene expression data normalized bulk RNA-seq count matrix, log2(fpkm+1) transformed. GSE121589 dataset contains chromatin accessibility gene expression data  33 mice Muscle Stem Cells (MuSCs). chromatin accessibility data normalized bulk ATAC-seq count matrix, prior count 5 added raw counts, put “counts per million”, log2 transformed, quantile normalized.  gene expression data normalized bulk RNA-seq count matrix, log2(fpkm+1) transformed. Two tab-delimited text/csv input files (chromatin accessibility matrix gene expression matrix) required running Linkage. gene expression matrix file tab-delimited multi-column data matrix, first column represents gene symbols following columns represent normalized raw expression levels genes sample. chromatin accessibility matrix file tab-delimited multi-column data matrix well, first three columns represent chromosome name, start coordinate chromosome end coordinate chromosome peaks respectively; remaining columns chromatin accessibility matrix file represent normalized raw chromatin accessibility levels peaks sample.  element  ready--analysis files appear Chromatin Accessibility Matrix panel Gene Expression Matrix panel.

title: linkage
text: Regulatory Peaks Search Module allows users detect potential regulatory DNA regions specific genes. given input gene targeting DNA regions, Linkage automatically perform canonical correlation analysis quantitative chromatin accessibility measure region quantitative expression level gene across samples. Users can easily adjust region interest customize correlation algorithm (Spearman / Pearson / Kendall). ,  statistically significant results  listed  Potential Cis-regulatory Regions panel.  clicking  specific region panel, users can view scatter plot quantitative chromatin accessibility gene expression Correlation Plot panel. rho FDR correlation analysis also shown scatter plot.

title: linkage
text: Regulatory Peaks Visualization Module allows users visualize coverage mapped ATAC-seq reads around given specific regulatory peak, well corresponding quantitative expression target gene regulatory peak. Users initially select regulatory peak obtained Regulatory Peaks Detection Module. Linkage categorizes samples five groups based quantitative chromatin accessibility  specific regulatory peak, ranging low high individual sample. coverage track mapped ATAC-seq reads boxplot target gene group shown simultaneously.

title: linkage
text: Regulatory Peaks Annotation Module allows users visualize annotation predicational regulatory peaks Linkage. users click ‘Annotate Regulatory Peaks’, Linkage perform annotation  predicational regulatory peaks terms genomic location features, includes whether peak TSS, Exon, 5’ UTR, 3’ UTR, Intronic Intergenic  position strand information nearest gene peaks. effectively visualize overlaps distribution annotation peaks, Linkage also produces upsetplot adopting ChIPseeker package.

title: linkage
text: Motif Analysis Module supports users visualize enriched transcription factor motifs within potential regulatory peaks. clicking  specific peak, users can view location binding score information enriched transcription factor region. users select one transcription factors, corresponding sequence logo cis-regulatory element appear Sequence-logo Plot panel.

title: linkage
text: Regulatory Network Module helps users  visualize GRNs  nodes genes corresponding cis-regulatory elements，inferred previous analysis Linkage. First, users can input list interested genes  upload  gene-list file obtained previous analysis.  users can adjust series parameters related building GRN, including types  gene symbols, calculation methods thresholds  interactions nodes (edges GRNs). users click ‘Build Network’, Linkage perform canonical correlation analysis quantitative expression level  interested gene  potential cis-regulatory elements. significant calculation results  correlation analysis  shown  Gene-TF Table panel. Meanwhile, Linkage produces corresponding informatic interactive GRN adopting visNetwork package. Users can easily change network layouts, select subnetworks, save GRN spreadsheets interaction score plots.

title: linkage
text: Pathway Enrichment Module supports users visualize tabular graphical pathway enrichment results interested gene lists, can produced previous analysis Linkage.  enrichment analysis can link gene lists underlying molecular pathways functional categories gene ontology (GO) Kyoto Encyclopedia Genes Genomes (KEGG).

title: TCGA-BRCA guided tutorial
text: tutorial, analyzing dataset Breast Cancer (BRCA) freely available TCGA.  dataset contains chromatin accessibility gene expression data  72 patients BRCA, can load LinkageData. can also found raw data . start loading data.  BreastCancerATAC()  BreastCancerRNA() function can load return available chromatin accessibility gene expression matrices Linkage. chromatin accessibility matrix normalized bulk ATAC-seq count matrix, prior count 5 added raw counts, put "counts per million", log2 transformed, quantile normalized. gene expression matrix normalized bulk RNA-seq count matrix, log2(fpkm+1) transformed. next use chromatin accessibility gene expression matrix create Linkage object. object serves container contains data (like count matrix) analysis (like regulatory peaks, active TFBS).
code: library(linkage) library(LinkageData) ATAC.seq <- BreastCancerATAC() RNA.seq <- BreastCancerRNA() LinkageObject <-   CreateLinkageObject(     ATAC_count = ATAC.seq,     RNA_count = RNA.seq,     Species = "Homo",     id_type = "ensembl_gene_id"   ) LinkageObject ## An LinkageObject  ## 59161 gene 215920 peak  ## Active gene: 0  ## Active peak: positive peak 0 negetive peak 0  ## Active TF: 0

title: TCGA-BRCA guided tutorial
text: Linkage allows search potential regulatory peaks given genes within specified region. example , detect potential regulatory peaks  three different genes (“TSPAN6”, “CD99”, “KLHL13”) within range 500000 bp around . plot top 6 significant results (sort FDR).
code: gene_list <- c("TSPAN6", "CD99", "KLHL13") LinkageObject <-   RegulatoryPeak(     LinkageObject = LinkageObject,     gene_list = gene_list,     genelist_idtype = "external_gene_name"   ) CorrPlot(LinkageObject, gene = "TSPAN6")

what: 3. Regulatory Peaks and Target Gene Visualization
title: TCGA-BRCA guided tutorial
text: Now can plot  Tn5 integration frequency  gene expression level across regions genome using TrackPlot() function. easier visualization, Linkage categorizes samples five groups based quantitative chromatin accessibility specific regulatory peak low high. group, pseudo-bulk accessibility tracks expression boxplot target gene can viewed. Alongside accessibility tracks can visualize important information including gene annotation peak coordinates.

title: TCGA-BRCA guided tutorial
text: Linkage can help visualize annotation predicational regulatory peaks. PeakAnnotation() perform annotation predicational regulatory peaks terms genomic location features, includes whether peak TSS, Exon, 5' UTR, 3' UTR, Intronic Intergenic position strand information nearest gene peaks. can produce upsetplot visualizing overlaps distribution annotation peaks AnnoUpsetPlot() function.

title: TCGA-BRCA guided tutorial
text: Next, can visualize enriched CREs within potential regulatory peaks MotifEnrichment() function. CREs TFs binding play central role gene transcription regulation, can detected ATAC-seq data. function can help view location binding score information enriched TFBS given DNA region. SeqLogoPlot() function help get sequence logo given transcription factors.
code: library(DT) df <- MotifEnrichment(LinkageObject@cor.peak$TSPAN6, "Homo") brks1 <-   quantile(df$score,            probs = seq(.05, .95, .05),            na.rm = TRUE) DT::datatable(   df,   selection = "single",   extensions = c("Scroller", "RowReorder"),   option = list(     rowReorder = TRUE,     deferRender = TRUE,     scrollY = 295,     scroller = TRUE,     scrollX = TRUE,     searchHighlight = TRUE,     orderClasses = TRUE,     autoWidth = F   ) ) %>% formatStyle(   names(df)[8],   background = styleColorBar(range(brks1), 'lightblue'),   backgroundSize = '90% 100%',   backgroundRepeat = 'no-repeat',   backgroundPosition = 'center' ) SeqLogoPlot("MA0618.1")

title: Authors and Citation
text: Liu Z (2024). linkage: R shiny web server linking ATAC-seq gene expression data. R package version 1.2.0, https://aicplane.github.io/Linkage-tutorial/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {linkage: An R shiny web server for linking of ATAC-seq to gene expression data},   author = {Zenghui Liu},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.2.0},   url = {https://aicplane.github.io/Linkage-tutorial/}, }

title: AnnoUpsetPlot — AnnoUpsetPlot
text: LinkageObject LinkageObject annottation. order_by intersections matrix ordered . Options include frequency (entered "freq"), degree, order.

title: AnnoUpsetPlot — AnnoUpsetPlot
code: library(linkage) data("SmallLinkageObject") gene_list <- c("TSPAN6", "CD99", "KLHL13") LinkageObject <-   RegulatoryPeak(     LinkageObject = SmallLinkageObject,     gene_list = gene_list,     genelist_idtype = "external_gene_name"   ) peakAnno <- PeakAnnotation(LinkageObject, Species = "Homo") #> Loading required package: org.Hs.eg.db #> Loading required package: AnnotationDbi #> Loading required package: stats4 #> Loading required package: BiocGenerics #>  #> Attaching package: 'BiocGenerics' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     IQR, mad, sd, var, xtabs #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     Filter, Find, Map, Position, Reduce, anyDuplicated, aperm, append, #>     as.data.frame, basename, cbind, colnames, dirname, do.call, #>     duplicated, eval, evalq, get, grep, grepl, intersect, is.unsorted, #>     lapply, mapply, match, mget, order, paste, pmax, pmax.int, pmin, #>     pmin.int, rank, rbind, rownames, sapply, setdiff, table, tapply, #>     union, unique, unsplit, which.max, which.min #> Loading required package: Biobase #> Welcome to Bioconductor #>  #>     Vignettes contain introductory material; view with #>     'browseVignettes()'. To cite Bioconductor, see #>     'citation("Biobase")', and for packages 'citation("pkgname")'. #> Loading required package: IRanges #> Loading required package: S4Vectors #>  #> Attaching package: 'S4Vectors' #> The following object is masked from 'package:utils': #>  #>     findMatches #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     I, expand.grid, unname #>  #> 'select()' returned 1:1 mapping between keys and columns #> 'select()' returned 1:many mapping between keys and columns #> 'select()' returned 1:1 mapping between keys and columns AnnoUpsetPlot(LinkageObject = peakAnno) #> Warning: `cols` is now required when using `unnest()`. #> ℹ Please use `cols = c(res)`.

title: MotifAnalysis. — BuildGRNs
text: LinkageObject Linkage Object RegulatoryPeak. Species Select species, Homo Mus.default Homo. TF_cor_method correlation calculation, pearson/spearman/kendall can selected.

title: MotifAnalysis. — BuildGRNs

title: Create a Linkage Object — CreateLinkageObject
text: ATAC_count chromatin accessibility matrix file tab-delimited multi-column data matrix well, first three columns represent chromosome name, start coordinate chromosome end coordinate chromosome peaks respectively; remaining columns chromatin accessibility matrix file represent normalized raw chromatin accessibility levels peaks sample. RNA_count gene expression matrix file tab-delimited multi-column data matrix, first column represents gene symbols following columns represent normalized raw expression levels genes sample. Species Select species, Homo Mus. id_type RNA_count gene id type. ensembl_gene_id, external_gene_name, entrezgene_id types genetic IDs choose .

title: Create a Linkage Object — CreateLinkageObject
code: library(linkage) library(LinkageData) #> Error in library(LinkageData): there is no package called 'LinkageData' ATAC.seq <- BreastCancerATAC() #> Error in BreastCancerATAC(): could not find function "BreastCancerATAC" RNA.seq <- BreastCancerRNA() #> Error in BreastCancerRNA(): could not find function "BreastCancerRNA" LinkageObject <-   CreateLinkageObject(     ATAC_count = ATAC.seq,     RNA_count = RNA.seq,     Species = "Homo",     id_type = "ensembl_gene_id"   ) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'RNA.seq' not found

title: Create Network Object. — FilterGRNs

title: Create Network Object. — FilterGRNs
code: library(linkage) library(LinkageData) #> Error in library(LinkageData): there is no package called 'LinkageData' ATAC.seq <- BreastCancerATAC() #> Error in BreastCancerATAC(): could not find function "BreastCancerATAC" RNA.seq <- BreastCancerRNA() #> Error in BreastCancerRNA(): could not find function "BreastCancerRNA" LinkageObject <-   CreateLinkageObject(     ATAC_count = ATAC.seq,     RNA_count = RNA.seq,     Species = "Homo",     id_type = "ensembl_gene_id"   ) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'RNA.seq' not found gene_list <- c("TSPAN6", "CD99", "KLHL13") LinkageObject <-   RegulatoryPeak(     LinkageObject = LinkageObject,     gene_list = gene_list,     genelist_idtype = "external_gene_name"   ) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'LinkageObject' not found LinkageObject <-   BuildGRNs(LinkageObject = LinkageObject,                         Species = "Homo",                         TF_cor_method = "pearson") #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'LinkageObject' not found LinkageObject <-   BuildGRNs(     LinkageObject = LinkageObject,     genelist_idtype = "entrezgene_id",     filter_col = "FDR",     filter_value = 0.01   ) #> Error in BuildGRNs(LinkageObject = LinkageObject, genelist_idtype = "entrezgene_id",     filter_col = "FDR", filter_value = 0.01): unused arguments (genelist_idtype = "entrezgene_id", filter_col = "FDR", filter_value = 0.01)

title: GO enrichment analysis — GOEnrichment
code: GOEnrichment(   gene_list,   Species = "Homo",   genelist_idtype,   pvalueCutoff = 0.05,   qvalueCutoff = 0.2,   minGSSize = 10,   maxGSSize = 500 )

title: GO enrichment analysis — GOEnrichment
text: gene_list list genes, required ensembl_gene_id, external_gene_name, entrezgene_id one three gene types. title: Annotation regulatory peak — PeakAnnotation
code: library(linkage) data("SmallLinkageObject") gene_list <- c("TSPAN6", "CD99", "KLHL13") LinkageObject <-   RegulatoryPeak(     LinkageObject = SmallLinkageObject,     gene_list = gene_list,     genelist_idtype = "external_gene_name"   ) peakAnno <- PeakAnnotation(LinkageObject, Species = "Homo") #> 'select()' returned 1:1 mapping between keys and columns #> 'select()' returned 1:many mapping between keys and columns #> 'select()' returned 1:1 mapping between keys and columns

VisualGRNs. — VisualGRNs
code: library(linkage) library(LinkageData) #> Error in library(LinkageData): there is no package called 'LinkageData' ATAC.seq <- BreastCancerATAC() #> Error in BreastCancerATAC(): could not find function "BreastCancerATAC" RNA.seq <- BreastCancerRNA() #> Error in BreastCancerRNA(): could not find function "BreastCancerRNA" LinkageObject <-   CreateLinkageObject(     ATAC_count = ATAC.seq,     RNA_count = RNA.seq,     Species = "Homo",     id_type = "ensembl_gene_id"   ) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'RNA.seq' not found gene_list <- c("TSPAN6", "CD99", "KLHL13") LinkageObject <-   RegulatoryPeak(     LinkageObject = LinkageObject,     gene_list = gene_list,     genelist_idtype = "external_gene_name"   ) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'LinkageObject' not found LinkageObject <-   BuildGRNs(LinkageObject = LinkageObject,                         Species = "Homo",                         TF_cor_method = "pearson") #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'LinkageObject' not found LinkageObject <-   BuildGRNs(     LinkageObject = LinkageObject,     genelist_idtype = "entrezgene_id",     filter_col = "FDR",     filter_value = 0.01   ) #> Error in BuildGRNs(LinkageObject = LinkageObject, genelist_idtype = "entrezgene_id",     filter_col = "FDR", filter_value = 0.01): unused arguments (genelist_idtype = "entrezgene_id", filter_col = "FDR", filter_value = 0.01) VisualGRNs(LinkageObject) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'LinkageObject' not found

title: TrackPlot — TrackPlot
code: library(linkage) data("SmallLinkageObject") gene_list <- c("TSPAN6", "CD99", "KLHL13")   LinkageObject <- RegulatoryPeak(   LinkageObject = SmallLinkageObject,   gene_list = gene_list,   genelist_idtype = "external_gene_name" ) TrackPlot(   LinkageObject,   Geneid = "TSPAN6",   peakid = "chrX:100635908-100636408",   Species = "Homo" )
